name: Maggie Beer
bio: Maggie Beer is an Australian chef, restaurateur, and television personality. She is known for her focus on using locally-sourced, seasonal ingredients in her cooking. Beer has published several cookbooks and has won numerous awards for her contributions to the food industry.
recipes_list: Slow-roasted Pork Belly with Fennel and Apple
Lemon Myrtle and Macadamia Nut Pavlova
Best recipe: Verjuice Roast Chicken with Fennel and Parsnips
Caramelised Onion and Goat's Cheese Tartlets
Grilled Scallops with Chilli and Lime

name: Curtis Stone
bio: Curtis Stone is an Australian celebrity chef, author, and television personality. He is the owner of several restaurants in the United States and Australia, and has published several cookbooks. Stone is known for his focus on fresh, locally-sourced ingredients in his cooking.
recipes_list: Grilled Lamb with Chimichurri Sauce
Spiced Carrot Soup with Yogurt and Crispy Chickpeas
Best recipe: Slow-cooked Beef Short Ribs with Red Wine Sauce
Prawn and Scallop Linguine with Tomato and Basil
Sticky Date Pudding with Butterscotch Sauce
Roast Pork Loin with Apple and Sage Stuffing

name: Neil Perry
bio: Neil Perry is an Australian chef and restaurateur. He is the owner of several acclaimed restaurants in Australia, including Rockpool Bar and Grill in Sydney and Melbourne. Perry is known for his focus on using high-quality, seasonal ingredients in his cooking, and has won numerous awards for his culinary work.
recipes_list: Green Curry of Barramundi with Rice Noodles
Beetroot and Feta Salad with Mint and Walnuts
Best recipe: Slow-cooked Beef Brisket with Smoky BBQ Sauce
Grilled King Prawns with Garlic and Lemon Butter
Lemon Tart with Raspberry Coulis

name: Shannon Bennett
bio: Shannon Bennett is an Australian chef, restaurateur, and cookbook author. He is the owner of several acclaimed restaurants in Melbourne, including Vue de Monde. Bennett is known for his inventive, modern cuisine and has won numerous awards for his contributions to the food industry.
recipes_list: Roast Lamb with Salsa Verde and Roasted Vegetables
Pea and Ham Soup with Crusty Bread
Best recipe: Slow-cooked Beef Cheeks with Red Wine and Mushroom Sauce
Poached Salmon with Asparagus and Hollandaise Sauce
Spiced Apple Cake with Cinnamon Cream

name: Peter Gilmore
bio: Peter Gilmore is an Australian chef and author. He is the executive chef of Quay, a restaurant in Sydney that has been awarded three hats by the Good Food Guide. Gilmore is known for his innovative, nature-inspired cuisine and has won numerous awards for his culinary work.
recipes_list: Grilled Wagyu Beef with Mushroom Sauce and Roasted Potatoes
Chilled Tomato and Basil Soup with Croutons
Best recipe: Slow-cooked Lamb Shoulder with Rosemary and Garlic
Prawn and Avocado Salad with Lime Dressing
Vanilla and Rhubarb Panna Cotta

name: Ben Shewry
bio: Ben Shewry is a New Zealand-born Australian chef and restaurateur. He is the owner and head chef of Attica, a restaurant in Melbourne that has been awarded three hats by the Good Food Guide. Shewry is known for his use of native Australian ingredients in his cooking and has won numerous awards for his culinary work.
recipes_list: Kangaroo Tartare with Finger Lime and Quandong
Roasted Cauliflower with Tahini and Pomegranate
Best recipe: Slow-cooked Lamb Shoulder with Native Herbs
Grilled Prawns with Lemon Myrtle Butter
Apple and Quince Crumble with Wattleseed Ice Cream
Pork and Fennel Sausage Rolls

name: Luke Mangan
bio: Luke Mangan is an Australian chef and restaurateur. He is the owner of several acclaimed restaurants in Australia, including Glass Brasserie at the Hilton Hotel in Sydney. Mangan is known for his modern Australian cuisine and has won numerous awards for his culinary work.
recipes_list: Grilled Barramundi with Roasted Vegetables
Chicken and Leek Pie with Buttery Pastry
